A Data Transfer Object (DTO) representing an event response in the external API layer, designed to encapsulate event information returned to clients.

## Key Components

- **EventResponse Class**: Main DTO with Lombok annotations for boilerplate code generation
- **Core Fields**:
  - `id`: Unique event identifier
  - `type`: Event classification (e.g., USER_LOGIN)
  - `payload`: JSON string containing event data
  - `timestamp`: When the event occurred
  - `userId`: Associated user identifier
- **Annotations**: Swagger/OpenAPI schema documentation for API documentation generation

## Usage Example

```java
// Creating an event response
EventResponse response = EventResponse.builder()
    .id("event-123")
    .type("USER_LOGIN")
    .payload("{\"action\": \"login\", \"ip\": \"192.168.1.1\"}")
    .timestamp(Instant.now())
    .userId("user-456")
    .build();

// Using in a REST controller
@GetMapping("/events/{id}")
public ResponseEntity<EventResponse> getEvent(@PathVariable String id) {
    EventResponse event = eventService.findById(id);
    return ResponseEntity.ok(event);
}

// Accessing fields
String eventType = response.getType();
Instant when = response.getTimestamp();
```
